WRITING.TEXT: Is this speculation or do you have evidence? Genuinely asking
This is what I've read in official reports, but based on user feedback and my own experience, this is broken or inaccurate
I'll try regular contact missions and report back.

WRITING.TITLE: Is there an answer about how to change your "Favorite Bike"?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've googled and I've tested different things but I can't seem to get the "favorite bike" to change. Any ideas?
Edit: Just so we can avoid repeat info and speculation, here's what I've experienced and what I've tried:
logged on after a long hiatus (this is post-CEO update) hopped on a Liberator and was told this was my favorite bike. (Didn't own a clubhouse and was not an MC Pres.)
after I bought a clubhouse, rode the Bagger for a while, probably did several missions on it, that became my favorite.
now I'm trying to get my Gargoyle to be my favorite and have ridden it for hours and probably a thousand+ miles.
completed dozens of MC wall missions and supply and delivery missions with Gargoyle.
moved the Gargoyle around in the clubhouse garage (though not every spot. I just traded spots with the Bagger and also put it in slot one)
modified the Gargoyle.
sincerely hoped with all my heart.

I wonder if modders can use NPC bounties (like when you steal and NPC car)
Wait. No, don't read this, modders!
I hope it's more serious in terms of being less arcade-y (stunt races and Tron bikes? No thanks) but in terms of humor, I love where Rockstar lands on the spoof and parody spectrum
So what about like VIP missions? Like headhunter, for example. This will basically determine if I buy it or not.
I realize that. The non sequitur is why it's funny.

Thanks for the feedback.
I'm thinking about maybe getting the Ruiner 2000 for things like contact missions where I'm bored of breezing through with a buzzard.
I'll take your comments into consideration.
Wait. You have to repair it after damage? Can you just return it to your garage like other PVs?

The two times I got $250,000, it was coming back from a break. I started to play a little while back after about a year or more break. They gave me $250,000.
Then during spring break I went out of town and when I booted it up again after about a 10-day break, I got another $250,000.
So my guess is they're rewarding people for coming back. Or at least it might increase their odds for RNG.
lol I thought it was funny. Oh well. Reddit is a fickle beast
Rare? They don't spawn in free roam. Anyway, I was just replying to OP's question about a transport vehicle for his motorcycles
Cars are always rare when you're looking for them... until you're not. Then they're everywhere. Amirite?!
[Get the Dump.](http://gta.wikia.com/wiki/Dump)
They can make it go 200mph but get totaled if you bump it once or twice. That would keep it balanced and not OP
Is this sarcasm? Cuz there's like one or two. Haha
I wonder how much money you could make an hour just taking other people's cars and turning them in. Is there a cool down?

You can pull shared (banked) money out of your main character's account and hold it in his wallet. Then switch to second character and that character will be broke.
Or just play in a invite only session for now. You can still be CEO and do VIP work, you just can't source and deliver cargo or cars.

Knowing everything that you know now with years of experience I think a fresh start would actually be kind of fun. No?
Quick edit: and if you're willing to pay someone $50 to help you anyway, maybe get a jump start with a $50 shark card?
Oh. Well then he's full of shit.

So you're doubling down?
Your Ford GT 2017 (Vapid FMJ) is actually an [ASTON MARTIN VULCAN](https://www.astonmartin.com/de/vulcan)
You're going to stick with this? ^

Jumping over checkpoints. I had thought the point of a race was to finish as quickly as possible. Why penalize people for hauling ass?
A lot of real life races have checkpoints too.

It takes a long time, no question. But if you're taking a ton of damage, you're doing it wrong.
Fly straight up until you see choppers on your radar, then book it to your warehouse. You'll make it with zero to very little damage.

I don't really get your point. If you do what you described and earn $14M "in a couple of days" but then log on on the third day to have your money depleted because of a modder, this wouldn't bother you?

Look at the the Vulcan. Then look at the FMJ.
Then look at the FMJ and look at the [Ford GT](https://www.google.com/search?q=ford+gt+2017 client=safari hl=en-us prmd=ivn source=lnms tbm=isch sa=X ved=0ahUKEwi1lb37qKTTAhVpwVQKHQ3ABNAQ_AUIBygB biw=414 bih=628).
The other guy was just being polite to you. You're clearly wrong. Vapid is Ford. They're not going to randomly turn the Vapid into an Aston Martin for no reason when Aston Martin is already Dewbauchee in the game.

I just rotate between parking and fighting (making back my ammo expenses in the VIP work during cool down); and cargobob straight up into the air and flying to the destination unmolested.
I only get 0% damage nowadays (unless I fuck it up on my own)

Do you do the 3x ($18000) crates, or the 2x or the 1x?
Just wondering if you go for ROI or $/hr
This is my experience too

He said
As long as you have at least one other player in the session that's not in your Org, you won't get any adds at all.
And you're going to stick with this?
but if that one other person leaves the session, your car instantly goes up in flames
You aren't wrong. Everyone has figured something out and this guy just complains the game is too hard.
Just do it differently then. Everyone else has figured out a way to do it.
No change in players' laziness, apparently.
GTA is more of an arcade racer than a driving simulator.
R/iamverybadass

Great collection!
I have to say I disagree with more than just a few of your IRL equivalencies.
I know nothing here is 100% and the in-game cars all have bits and pieces of a few IRL cars, but I think more credence should be paid toward the creator's nomenclature. Like the new Vapid truck is probably not a Toyota, just as one example.
Nice collection, nonetheless.
You're wrong.

The Voltic is an electric car.
That should be the defining factor.

I totally get your point. When I PvP in free mode (rare, these days because I/E) I always mixed it up. Sniper, then CQC with rifles or a shotgun, then bust out the mini gun for a kill or two, then switch to a rocket because he's ducked around a corner and won't come out, then back to rifles again when he spawns closer, etc.
But to your point, if it's all gun battles, I'd get tired and want to see an explosion once in a while and, theoretically, one could go through a "explosion phase" that they're really enjoying.
In the end, it's a pretty balanced game and it's the user base that skews it in one direction or another.
Having said that, yes, custom servers would be nice.
I just do the behind the bar trick. Nbd. I just thought of the bull shark that in time and thought I'd try it. I'd rather not lose money on these missions. Otherwise I'd just buy the supplies.
I'm down there too. But mainly I play in solo public lobbies so it doesn't bother me if others catch on
I wonder if turning off distance blur/depth of field effects in your game options will help with the blur issue you described

Yes I have. (I'm level 396 or so.)
As I'm typing this I'm realizing that I think I accidentally called Dom instead of Brucie.
I tried calling him but he wouldn't pick up.

To be fair, the fact that there is a Creator Mode is leaps and bounds above any AAA title out there.
I was just making some races today and was thinking to myself how cool it is that they even made a Creator Mode.
The discrepancy seems huge. But current sales and promotions do affect sale prices.

I've never gotten closer than rage quitting on a contact mission than this mission.
I'm all for a fair fight, win or lose.
But that mfer that double teams you with a broken bottle and then stabs you again after your Wasted Screen, just for good measure? Omg I almost threw my controller
Could be a troll, too.
Is "photos or it didn't happen" appropriate here?

You had to be somewhat tech savvy. Basically people were redirecting GTA:O's server-side activity to their own computers via DNS manipulation.
So now they had the power to host lobbies and control the variables that are normally server-side.
The most common money "hack" was introducing bounties on people that was worth billions of dollars.
If you got it out on you, all you had to do was survive it in a solo session and the money was yours. If you saw someone else in the lobby with it, you'd try to kill them.
I managed to kill a $4B bounty and was so rich I couldn't spend all my money. I bought everything in the game. It was fantastic while it lasted. :-)
First World problems.
And VIP work can be done in an invite only session

Yeah -- they had that bundle for free shark cards along with purchase of game
But I feel like this guy already has the game

Even on this list he says he "still needs" the red comet. I didn't realize it was THAT rare.
This must be after the unlock then. Because back after release, you couldn't keep the rat loader.

That's a dope collection. How did you get the rat loader to store? I'm aware of old glitches for the lifeguard ATV and stuff, but don't recall a rat loader glitch. Or is this after Rockstar made them stealable? I can't keep up anymore

WRITING.TITLE: I found these two NPC modified vehicles. I haven't seen these before.
WRITING.TEXT:
Of course I've seen the Ruiner and the Dominator and the usual Sandkings, Sentinels, Dubsta 2s, etc. but these two were new to me:
[Voltic](http://imgur.com/iQ8vujM) [Pfister](http://imgur.com/FZgj5pq)
Sorry for potato quality photos.

The raid or robbery is an event not unlike other contact missions in single player.
You get a call and you have to got kill some people and grab a package or objective, and that's that. It happens live in the lobby (not in a separate, loaded mission) and it won't happen without you being able to tend to it.
A lot of the"regular cars" are not purchasable. It's best to enjoy the hunt and find one for yourself. Way more rewarding that way, anyway :-)

Half the lobby behind me had mics
This is where you lost me. Hahah I usually spend the lobby time muting everyone. It makes for a much more pleasant experience :)
Usually 2am (pacific time) on the date in question. I think.

WRITING.TITLE: CEOs should be able to have aircraft spawn at helipad/airfield of choice
WRITING.TEXT: Now that Rockstar has no fear of breaking the game or breaking immersion with instaspawn vehicles and vanishing personal vehicles back to their garages, we really shouldn't suffer from "you're-closest-but-not-too-close" airfield issues anymore.

Way back in the DNS hacking days, I killed a player with a $4-billion bounty on his head. $4B is an unspendable amount of cash.
You literally could buy, modify, and sell every car in the game over and over again, once a day repeatedly and in succession, and it would take you over a month to do it. $60B? I can't even fathom it
The weed and cocaine stuff is for a Motorcycle Club and its satellite businesses. Google GTA V MC
Not to minimize your experience but you can make $100,000 in about 20 minutes of CEO work after your initial investment pays off.

Try Gang attacks.
[I posted this a while back](https://www.reddit.com/r/GrandTheftAutoV/comments/2iw1pn/recapping_the_time_i_finished_all_gang_attacks/)
Do all the contact missions too!
There's plenty to do solo!

[Garage office next to LSC by the prison](https://i.imgur.com/XraSVOE.jpg)
[my favorite hideout at LSIA](https://i.imgur.com/h7pF04J.png)
There's also office and backroom areas at Devon Weston's hangar and the hangar directly across from his.
There's some mobile trailer offices that you cab access with a lot of detail over by the shipping yard (near docks to stocks mission)
There is the abandoned mine shaft
If you're into wall breaches, there are several more. But I don't know what has been patched
If you go down to rodeo drive you will definitely see some super cars.
By the way, do you do all businesses or just coke or what?

Omg I'm so back-and-forth on this. Now I think I should again.
I mean I have $60M in the bank and the CEO stuff with maxed out garages and medium cargo warehouse. Pretty happy with my money-making ability right now.
I wanted to do the MC coke as a change of pace -- and with the solo public lobbies I figured it's pretty doable. But if it's glitchy and half the missions are too hard to complete, it might be a waste of money.
I would like to use the garage for bikes, though. That would be cool. Right now I have them all stored at a stilt mansion garage.
What to do. What to do.
Can you still use the motorcycle garage space if shut down?
And by "quit" I mean quit the game or switch sessions. There's no way to quit normally.
Just three.
I guess I won't be buying MC after all.
Bernie Madoff at it again.
You can't choose. The go-to response now is if it is the 3-plane mission, quit. You will lose crates for quitting it, but it's worth the time, stress, and potential fail. (You lose three crates)

He just said the thing I quoted and then made his recommendation. Nothing big. I just didn't understand why he was quoting his PC stats. He said it was because different cars have different handling characteristics based on frame rate and keyboard/controller input types, etc. no big deal really. But I guess he got downvoted enough for him to delete. This sub can be brutal. Haha
I bought mine based on accessibility from downtown. I found the easiest one to drive to and bought it
It sounds like you don't want to play it anymore if that's the case, that's too bad. Have fun with Destiny 2 or whatever other game you decide to play. We wish you well.

It's too much fun to just quit. I mean if you are principled against Rockstar now because they banned you, that's one thing. I can understand that position.
But is the fun you have worth $60US? I think definitely
There's not much out there that can give you this much entertainment for such an affordable price.

The Rhapsody from the I'm not a hipster update is what you're looking for, friend.
It's the perfect size. It's big but definitely not "too" big.

This is incorrect. The car won't despawn but it kicks everyone out once you pull out a new PV.

In terms of apartment location, view, etc, I think Weazel towers 101 is the best.
centrally located
top floor view
three or more entrances to the garage if you're running from cops or other players or just in a hurry
separate building walk-in entrance which is great for battling other players that are staking you out. You can exit from a different exit than where they're waiting.
less populated and congested than Eclipse (which I also own)
plus it's Nakatomi Plaza from Die Hard. So that pretty much seals the deal.

I did my own tests and the Karin BeeJay XL is actually an outstanding 4x4 with great handling and really sticky, steep, uphill climb ability.
I [created a 4x4 off road test track](http://rsg.ms/a6aefc9) a while back that you can use to test inclines and grip, etc. It's for PS4.
I've found the BeeJay is excellent and it's super cheap too. (Free if you find one to steal.) and it looks awesome all blacked out and has some cool customization options. Not a ton, but enough to make it look great.
Give it a shot. Most people overlook the BeeJay for off road and so it's unique on top of everything else.
Right now it's actually advantageous to be in an empty public lobby because successful CEO work suffers from griefers. But yeah ... have fun!

It loads fast and connects 100% for me (I'm PS4)
If anything, going to rest mode on PS4 might make it kind of hinky after a couple of days. It just reboot the game after that and it's great again.

The Entity used to be my go-to super for years. It was king for a long time. But now there are definitely better ones. If you're looking for cheap, then yeah maybe it's still a contender because all the new ones are so expensive.
It's definitely still a good free roam car because it's so easy to drive and it's bullet proof in the rear. So it's good for killing NPCs by backing up and shooting out the rear window.

WRITING.TITLE: If you've purchased a modification or part for a car, you should always have that part available to switch back to it if you want to change it...
WRITING.TEXT:
With the exception of paint jobs, tints, and perhaps a small service fee for labor, I should be able to switch to any spoiler (for example) that I've purchased in the past.
Obviously major chassis changes might not apply here in terms of lore, but most modifications should be reversible for a small fee.
